conclusion: Given data taken from the P-V diagram
State C → State D is a horizontal (isobaric) line.
Pressure along C → D: p = 0.75 × 10⁵ Pa = 7.5 × 10⁴ Pa.
Volume changes from V_C = 4 L to V_D = 3 L.
ΔV = V_D − V_C = 3 L − 4 L = −1 L.
Work done by the gas during an isobaric step is W = p ΔV
A negative sign means the gas does 75 J less work on the surroundings; equivalently, 75 J of work is done on the gas.
Final answer: Work done externally by the gas during C → D: −75 J (i.e. 75 J of work is done on the gas).
